title: True Crime | Fox News
description: The hottest stories ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

paragraphs: This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. ©2025 FOX News Network, LLC. All rights reserved. Quotes displayed in real-time or delayed by at least 15 minutes. Market data provided by Factset. Powered and implemented by FactSet Digital Solutions. Legal Statement. Mutual Fund and ETF data provided by Refinitiv Lipper.
Florida cheerleader's death on Carnival cruise ship prompts FBI investigation while stepmother seeks court delay over self-incrimination concerns.
Karen Read filed a lawsuit alleging a conspiracy by law enforcement officials to frame her for her boyfriend's death after her acquittal on murder charges.
Mysterious death of Florida teen on Carnival cruise ship remains unsolved after 10 days. FBI investigates as autopsy results still pending.
Brian Walshe pleads guilty to misleading police and unlawful conveyance in Ana Walshe murder case, but denies killing his wife as jury selection begins.
Missing wife's body never found, but prosecutors say digital evidence shows Brian Walshe searched how to dispose of human remains before buying suspicious items.
Before becoming the Unabomber, Ted Kaczynski underwent intense psychological experiments at Harvard. Experts question if these studies influenced his bombing spree.
Forensic expert reveals how rapid DNA genetic genealogy could revolutionize crime solving, making it faster and cheaper than traditional detective work.
Casey Sherman, author and nephew of Boston Strangler victim Mary Sullivan, reveals why he doesn't believe Albert DeSalvo was the real killer despite DNA evidence and confessions.
Brian Walshe ruled competent to stand trial for wife Ana's murder. Massachusetts judge sets December trial date after mental health evaluation at Bridgewater.
An Idaho court says killer Bryan Kohberger got $28,000 in jail donations and may still profit from future media deals under the state's “Son of Sam" law.
Luigi Mangione's defense team demands prosecutors clarify if his mother actually made controversial statement about UnitedHealthcare CEO killing to police.
Daren Christopher Abbey found guilty of murdering Dustin Kjersem with an axe at a Montana campsite in a brutal killing initially reported as a bear attack.
Murdaugh family housekeeper reveals the beach towel evidence that finally convinced her Alex Murdaugh killed his wife Maggie and son Paul in shocking 2021 murders.
Judge Thomas Rubinson rejected Fraser Bohm's motion to dismiss murder charges for a crash that killed four Pepperdine University Alpha Phi sorority students on Pacific Coast Highway.
Bucks County cold case solved after 63 years as grand jury identifies killer of 9-year-old Carol Ann Dougherty murdered in Bristol church in 1962.
Robert Piest, 15, left work to meet contractor John Wayne Gacy about a job on his mother's birthday in 1978. He never returned home and became Gacy's final known victim.
Former TV anchor Angelynn Mock was charged with first-degree murder in the alleged stabbing death of her 80-year-old mother in a Wichita home on Halloween.
Bryan Kohberger's lawyers argue he shouldn't pay full restitution in Idaho murders case. Hearing today focused on money owed to victims' families.
Alex Murdaugh slams a new Hulu drama series about his family murders, calling it "sensationalized" and inaccurate in an explosive statement from prison.
Over 2,300 pages of Idaho murders investigation records released, revealing DNA testing details and evidence that connected Bryan Kohberger to crime scene.
Former news anchor Angelynn Mock charged with first-degree murder after allegedly stabbing her 80-year-old mother to death in their Wichita home.
Bryan Kohberger's academic arrogance about "undertrained" police backfired when digital forensics experts exposed his Idaho student murder cover-up attempts.
Aileen Wuornos confessed to protect her girlfriend who betrayed her to police. Explore the tragic love story behind Florida's deadliest female serial killer.
Idaho prosecutors file murder charges four years after 5-year-old Michael Vaughan vanished from Fruitland neighborhood in 2021 disappearance case.
Connecticut woman demands court reveal stepson's new identity after alleged 20-year captivity case. Kimberly Sullivan claims constitutional right to confront accuser.
Convicted Idaho student murderer Bryan Kohberger received financial "compensation" from family and third parties while behind bars, prosecutors revealed in a court filing.
Shawn Stines' daughter defends family on social media amid murder trial for Kentucky courthouse shooting that killed District Judge Kevin Mullins.
Luigi Mangione has gained a prominent jail status as the UnitedHealthcare CEO murder suspect, earning respect through wealth and a high-profile case at a Brooklyn detention center.
Family raises concerns over autopsy errors in Kenneth Cutting Jr.'s case after 22-year-old found dead in Houston's Buffalo Bayou with undetermined cause of death.
Aaron Pennington allegedly shot his wife Breanne Pennington three times in Gardner, Massachusetts, then fled, leaving their four children with her body in 2023.
New leads emerge in Amy Bradley's 1998 cruise ship disappearance case after Netflix documentary reportedly generates hundreds of tips to FBI investigators.
Christopher Revak, suspected serial killer and person of interest in Jodi Huisentruit's disappearance, was identified as responsible for Deidre Harm's 2006 murder.
Dr. Mildred Muhammad, the ex-wife of D.C. sniper John Allen Muhammad, shares her harrowing story of domestic violence and terror in new true-crime documentary "Hunted by My Husband."
Family disputes police theory that Kenneth Cutting Jr. accidentally drowned in Buffalo Bayou, citing suspicious circumstances and his swimming ability.
Bryan Kohberger's lawyers ask judge to excuse $27,000 in payments to Idaho murder victims' families, citing GoFundMe donations already received.
Houston officials face mounting pressure as 16 bodies have been pulled from the city's bayous this year, sparking debate over whether a serial killer is targeting victims.
Kerri Rawson confronts her father Dennis Rader, the BTK killer, after nearly 20 years in prison, leading to her final decision to cut all contact with him.
Alex Murdaugh was sentenced to life in prison for murdering his wife and son, ending a legal dynasty after prosecutors uncovered millions in stolen funds.
The mother of Maria Niotis calls for justice after her teenage daughter and friend Isabella Salas died in a New Jersey crash involving an alleged juvenile stalker facing murder charges.
Ellen Greenberg's 2011 death ruling as suicide by 23 stab wounds faces continued scrutiny after new medical examiner reaffirms finding abandoned by original doctor.
Patricia Krenwinkel, one of Charles Manson’s most notorious followers, was once again denied parole as families of the Tate-LaBianca victims relive the horror that shocked America.
Cheryl Harris Gates faces attempted murder charges for allegedly spiking her husband's Celsius energy drink with prescription medications in North Carolina.
Court filings reveal Amanda Kohberger appeared on witness lists for both sides days before Bryan Kohberger accepted his plea deal to avoid trial.
Russell Laffitte gets 13-year sentence and must pay $3.5 million restitution for financial crimes that helped Alex Murdaugh conceal fraudulent schemes for years.
Dr. Justin Rutherford is in prison after pleading guilty to sexually abusing his stepson and another minor. While awaiting trial, he attempted to arrange his stepson's murder.
Houston authorities deny serial killer connections after 16 bodies recovered from bayous, while retired detective Kevin Gannon proposes controversial theory.
Bryan Kohberger pleaded guilty to killing Madison Mogen, Kaylee Goncalves, Xana Kernodle and Ethan Chapin and received four consecutive life sentences.
Rebecca Lafferty forgives her father Dan Lafferty, a convicted killer, to heal from trauma related to the 1984 murders of her aunt, Brenda Lafferty, and infant cousin, Erica.
An Idaho judge blocked the release of certain graphic images related to the murders of Ethan Chapin, Madison Mogen, Xana Kernodle and Kaylee Goncalves.
Prosecutors allege Sarah Hartsfield injected her diabetic husband Joseph with excessive insulin and delayed calling 911, leading to his death in January 2023.
The hottest stories ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

By entering your email and clicking the Subscribe button, you agree to the Fox News Privacy Policy and Terms of Use, and
        agree to receive content and promotional communications from Fox News. You understand that you can
        opt-out at any time.
You've successfully subscribed to this newsletter!

        Factset. Powered and implemented by

        Refinitiv Lipper.
